decks.notes: The main concept of this Amulet Titan deck is to efficiently ramp up mana, utilizing cards like Arboreal Grazer and Amulet of Vigor to accelerate the casting of big threats like Primeval Titan. The deck also includes various lands that provide additional value, such as Urza's Saga and Boseiju, Who Endures. The ultimate goal is to generate a powerful board presence and overwhelm the opponent with massive creatures and combo potential. The deck focuses on synergy between cards and land interaction to achieve victory in one-on-one matchups.

The deck focuses on utilizing land ramp and the Amulet of Vigor to quickly and efficiently cast Primeval Titan, allowing for explosive plays and combo potential. By using cards like Arboreal Grazer and Amulet of Vigor to accelerate mana production, the deck can quickly assemble the pieces needed to win the game through powerful land-based combos and strong creature threats. The inclusion of cards like Scapeshift and Urza's Saga further enhance the deck's ability to search for specific key pieces and execute its game plan effectively.

This deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures with high power and low mana cost to quickly deal damage to the opponent. The key strategy is to control the board with removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Leyline Binding while maintaining a strong board presence with creatures like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Scion of Draco. The mana base is designed to support a diverse range of colors to cast spells efficiently. Additionally, the inclusion of Arena of Glory allows for additional combat damage and the ability to pressure the opponent even more.

The key concept of this deck is to utilize the synergy between the creatures Basking Broodscale and Glaring Fleshraker alongside the support of Writhing Chrysalis to create a powerful combo. The deck also includes various cards that can generate mana or tutor for key pieces, such as Kozilek's Command and Ancient Stirrings. The presence of Emrakul, the Promised End adds a strong finisher to the deck. The lands in the deck are carefully chosen to support the deck's strategy and ensure proper mana fixing.

The deck focuses on quickly pumping out artifacts onto the battlefield to power up the affinity mechanic and overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. It utilizes cards like Pinnacle Emissary, Ornithopter, and Memnite to quickly deploy threats, while also including interaction through counter cards like Metallic Rebuke and disruption with cards like Tormod's Crypt and Sink into Stupor. The deck aims to consistently draw cards with Thoughtcast and utilize the mana acceleration from cards like Springleaf Drum and Mox Opal to push through damage and control the game.

The main goal of this deck is to apply pressure with aggressive creatures while disrupting your opponent's game plan with tempo plays like Ephemerate and Solitude. By combining enchantment synergies with creatures that provide value and disruption, this deck aims to control the board and outvalue opponents in the mid to late game. With a mix of removal, card advantage, and disruptive elements, this Death and Taxes deck seeks to disrupt and control the game while applying pressure to the opponent.

This deck focuses on disrupting your opponent's game plan while applying consistent pressure with aggressive creatures. By utilizing efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize, as well as tempo plays with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Ephemerate, you can control the board and push through damage. The creatures in the deck are versatile and resilient, allowing you to adapt to different matchups. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements and ensure you can cast your spells when needed.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by utilizing the UrzaTron lands to generate large amounts of mana quickly, allowing for powerful Eldrazi creatures such as Emrakul, the Promised End to be cast early in the game. The deck also includes disruptive tools like Ugin, Karn, and Chalice of the Void to hinder the opponent's strategies, while cards like Portent of Calamity and Kozilek's Command provide additional control options. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with big threats and disruption while maintaining a strong board presence.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm your opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells, while also utilizing Leylines to control the board and protect your creatures. The deck aims to quickly establish a board presence and deal damage efficiently, using cards like Lightning Bolt and Leyline Binding to maintain tempo and pressure. Additionally, the deck includes versatile cards like Stubborn Denial and Consign to Memory to handle threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan. By combining aggression with control elements, this deck can quickly close out games and outmaneuver opponents in a Modern 1 vs 1 format.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly with Arboreal Grazer and Amulet of Vigor to enable explosive plays with Primeval Titan and Scapeshift. Utilizing cards like Explore and Urza's Saga for card advantage and land searching, the deck aims to quickly assemble the necessary pieces for a lethal combo finish. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Aftermath Analyst and Cultivator Colossus provide alternative win conditions or backup plans in case the primary combo is disrupted. The variety of utility lands like Boseiju, Who Endures and Mirrorpool provide additional flexibility and options in different matchups.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on aggressive creatures and burn spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent, while also incorporating some control elements like removal and disruption. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of efficient creatures like Ragavan and Phlage, along with burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Thraben Charm. It also includes some utility cards like Ajani and Voice of Victory to provide additional benefits and support. The deck utilizes a mix of land cards to ensure consistency and flexibility in casting spells.

The deck focuses on using the Broodscale Bloodchief combo to generate a powerful board presence and overwhelm the opponent. It utilizes cards like Basking Broodscale and Glaring Fleshraker to create tokens, while using Writhing Chrysalis to further enhance the board. Cards like Emrakul, the Promised End and Walking Ballista serve as win conditions, while Blade of the Bloodchief and Kozilek's Command provide support. The deck also includes ramp tools like Urza's Saga and Eldrazi Temple, as well as disruption and card advantage cards like Ugin, Eye of the Storms and Soul-Guide Lantern.

The main idea of this deck is to aggressively disrupt your opponent's game plan while slowly building up your own board presence with efficient creatures. By combining both tempo plays with disruptive elements, you can control the game and overwhelm your opponent with a mix of removal, hand disruption, and powerful creatures. With a focus on disrupting your opponent's resources and maintaining pressure on the board, this deck aims to control the pace of the game and come out on top through careful resource management and strategic plays.

This deck aims to quickly fill up the graveyard with powerful creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Griselbrand, then use spells like Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate to bring them back into play at instant speed. By combining instant reanimation with disruptive elements like Force of Negation and Thoughtseize, the deck is able to control the game while setting up powerful combo plays. The inclusion of cards like Psychic Frog and Quantum Riddler help to further manipulate graveyards and disrupt opponents, creating a versatile and powerful combo-based strategy.

This deck focuses on quickly getting powerful creatures like Griselbrand onto the battlefield from your library or graveyard, with cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate. By utilizing instant-speed reanimation spells and disruptive cards like Thoughtseize and Force of Negation, you aim to create strong board presence while disrupting your opponent's game plan. A combination of card draw, counterspells, and removal allows you to control the game until you can assemble your combo pieces and win the game in a single turn. The deck combines graveyard synergy and reanimation with a control shell to achieve its goal.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game using powerful Eldrazi creatures and spells, while also utilizing the UrzaTron lands to ramp up mana quickly. Devourer of Destiny, Sowing Mycospawn, and Thought-Knot Seer provide early game threats, while Karn, the Great Creator and Ugin, Eye of the Storms can take over the late game. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy with cards like Kozilek's Command and Dismember, ultimately overwhelming them with powerful Eldrazi creatures and control cards.
